post.body: They have most everything I've looked for. The FEW absent titles were easily found elsewhere. Good prices, easy to use. Thumbs up!
Yup, I've been using Audible now for a little over 6 months. Since I'm locked into iTunes/iPod, I figured 'Why Not?' Really happy
My day went pretty well. Worked, got paid, AND had fun. Can't ask for more than that! What about you? Anything interesting?
I've just made my own website where I have sold mine so I make ALL the money. ;-) But, yeah, Audible is a force in the industry
I've been eyeballing "Outliers" and yes, it's already on Audible. Thanks for the recommendation. I'll pick it up
I have a couple of really promising students. Then, there's 1 young guy who's already teaching and gigging who gonna be great
As if on cue, there's the website plug! Nice work. ;-) I need to stop being so cheap and hire somebody part-time. But I'm so cheap
It's a great book. I thought it's be a bit more of a textbook, but it's really 'a trip inside the head' of Stephen King.
You're very welcome. Any time I can be of assistance, just holler! (That's a Southern term for 'contact me' lol)
"GET OFF OF MY LAWN!!!!!"... Damned kids. LOL
I hope I'm not gonna be one of those old grumpy farts when I become a senior citizen. ;-)
Had a client actually prefer the sound of his Macbook mic over $4K worth of signal chain because "yours sounds too much like me"
Have had a few ckients recording at home on GB and then wonder why the 'real' studio sound is so different.
As long as I'm not typing/doing some sort of office work, I have music on constantly. But I can't process clerical w/ it on
I don't listen to music while I do office work because I don't have the ability to passively listen to music. It draws my attention
You couldn't have served up a better plug for my audio book if I had actually asked for it personally? Thanks! ;-)
Yes, there's a great self-help audio book written specifically 4 drummers. I wrote it and it's available at BrianStephens.com ;-)
it's certainly a unique life if ever there was one.
I think I actually died and went to Hell. It's just that nobody actually told me.
I'd take pics but that would just be rude! ;-)
Wow, you just described the last 5 months of my life with him. Amazing!
So, if anybody wonders why my next book or CD project is late... I was helping an 11y/o with homework. ;-)
Man, if my kid were retarded, I might give him a break. But lazy?! Yeah, we just spent 2.5 hours on 40 minutes worth of homework
About to find out. I'll let u know shortly.
I can tell you, it's better than The Jonas Brothers (or insert any other tween music) on any day of the week. LOL
Don't know why I'm still awake. I did just watch Chris Coleman's drum instructional DVD. Of course I plan on stealing a few of his licks ;-)
Getting the itch to get back to 'real'/regular blogging and podcasting. Maybe after Christmas. I've started to miss it over the past month.
Lil B had a perfect day at school. I was so happy and proud! I guess the behavorial modification is working! ;-)
Handed off this REC session with a young local band to my assistant Matt while they finish a few things up. Now, I'm headed to the gym.
Setting up for a band session that will go till later in the evening. Local ATL rock band demoing new songs.
The reason to not fall asleep at 10pm? Smaller risk of waking up at 12:30AM, unable to get back to sleep. Back to the iPod and audio books.
Listening to more of Malcolm Gladwell's "The Tipping Point" thanks to Audible.com
Uh oh, Daddy's cooking tonite! Somebody grab the fire extinguisher.
Taught a couple of drums lessons and am now getting in a little practice for myself as well.
I want a secretary that can handle all this clerical stuff. I don't really enjoy office work.
And I thought I knew a lot about computer tech history. How did I miss this?! http://ping.fm/mVgcd
Broadcasting live on Qik: http://qik.com/video/690341
At rehearsals for PRUMC's Sunday night concert.
Awake, working on cue sheets 4 Sunday nite's concert (and this morning's rehearsal). Probably putting WAY more effort into this than needed
Getting off the grid for the night. Need lots of sleep before tomorrow
I'm finished venting. Time for frozen yogurt!!!!
I'm gonna say it. Garageband is a toy compared to the tools used in a pro studio. If U really want Fisher Price stop asking for Ferrari!!!
Still cutting vocals. Check out the studio cam at http://tinyurl.com/studio
Got the studio cam up and recording some vocal tracks for local ATL rappers at http://ping.fm/L6aUD
Got the studio cam up and recording some vocal tracks for local ATL rappers at http://tinyurl.com/studiocam
In a cynical mood today. None I the folks walking into my studio are helping ease the mood at all.
Starting on Audible.com's version of Malcolm Gladwell's "The Outliers" this morning. Thanks to everyone who recommended it to me.
Mmm... Apple Jacks.
So is this what an Ocean Street show is like from the audience? I think this is my first one. http://snipurl.com/8r9lw
This is just wrong! http://snipurl.com/8r6n4
I'm backstage at the Ocean Street show and there's a 300lb man here, naked from the waist up. Waist down: Santa Claus.
Hanging with my buds in the Nick Longo Band at Sambuca. http://snipurl.com/8qkku
Heading down to Buckhead and, specifically, to Sambuca to hear some buddies play.
I'm very sad. Just heard that someone responsible for some really cool things in my career passed away several days ago. RIP Bill Miller.
I'm catching up on phone calls and emails for a bit.
Got this band all set up to do guitar tracks and handing things over to my assistant engineer, Matt, who's working with them on their demo.
Back at the studio, teaching an audio engineer student before today's session.
Heading down to Buckhead to try out some new wireless headset microphones.
Yup, I'm awake so I guess I'll get some drum practice in before the 'real' day starts.
I'm done. 'Nite ya'll
Can somebody tell me how to get an 11y/o boy to give a sh*t about school?! OMG, I'm spent and could probably use a drink right about now.
Great workout and even squeezed in some dinner time with the family. Gonna veg and listen to an audiobook for a bit.
Just got back from the studio party. Lots of musicians hanging out along with plenty of new faces (new for me anyway). Now, time for Zzz's
Hanging at my buddy's studio around the corner at a holiday party. Looks like we'll all be jamming later
I know I must be a lil tired when every tempo seems too fast. Just relying on the muscle memory and trying 2 not let Mr. Sleepy pull us down
Gigging with the Interactive Band this afternoon till around 7pm.
Getting on The Good Foot while locking down on this burrito. There's a punchline in there somewhere, just can't seem to find it today.
Grabbing some lunch before heading over to this afternoon's gig with The Interactive Band. New sticks, new stickbag, and new heads in tow.
Running FOH sound and some video cams at Peachtree UMC all this morning till around 1pm.
Woke up really early for no real reason, so I'm heading down to the studio to practice some drums before my day 'officially' starts.
Headed over to Mall of GA so Ro can spend some of her Christmas money. I just feel like I need a nap. This holiday vacationing is so tiring!
Just ordered some new snare wires for this vintage 60's Ludwig 'High Stepper" marching snare that I've had in storage for about 15 years.
Helping the Mrs. with straightening up the house after the wonderful Xmas holiday. Her OCD is in a tizzy over the mess around here.
Snare drum sound amazing! Now, moving onto putting together a new drum tech box for the road. Will take pics and blog post on this later.
Awake early and rehabbing my favorite snare drum with new Evans heads and Puresound snares while watching The Band's "The Last Waltz" DVD.
Found out my kid can SING tonite as he sang along with all the songs on Guitar Hero while playing the guitar controller. Has great pitch.
Only 3 grams of fat... There IS a God!! http://snipurl.com/95bri
Having dinner with the family at Olde Towne Tavern in Suwanee because we're all tired of turkey and dressing.
I've been a complete bum all day, ya'll. A lil shopping, a lil eating, a lil napping, rinse and repeat. Might soon tire of this and be bored
I never thought I'd hear The Scorpions' music playing around my house unless I was the one who'd actually hit PLAY. Thanks Guitar Hero!
